abstract.para: Minos Core is a special module containing some supporting base classes to work with in further modules. Common technical concerns like database access is configured here.
As concerns dealing with users are tightly coupled to the Minos Core, the user management module resides within Minos Core project. Nevetheless it resides in its own package org.synyx.minos.umt.

section.title: org.synyx.minos.core.domain
section.para: This package contains AbstractEntity as a base class for entities as well as direct dependents like User and its Role. Thus the primary setup for entities is realized where the creating and modifying date and user is stored for each entity.

section.title: org.synyx.minos.core.dao.aspect
section.para: This package contains aspects regarding the DAO layer. E.g. the one setting modification and creation date and user.

section.title: org.synyx.minos.core.dao-context.xml
section.para: Declaration of the DAOs for modules Core and UMT.

section.title: infrastructure.xml
section.para: This configuraion file defines beans to provide core functionality regarding database access. Minos uses JPA as data access abstraction layer. Thus you can find Spring JPA specific configuration code here. Core database properties are factored out into database.properties file to prevent the need to edit the config file for workaday tasks. This should ease administrator's work on deployment of Minos.

section.title: WEB-INF/web.xml
section.para: This is the core configuration file declaring Minos servlets and including configuration files from modules.

section.title: WEB-INF/minos-servlet.xml
section.para: This is a simple delegating configuration file needed by Spring's Dispatcher Servlet default configuration. Here we simply import a wildcarded configuration file so that all configuration files matching the naming convention org.synyx.minos.${moduleName}.web.web-context.xml will be regarded as described here.

section.title: WEB-INF/rest-servlet.xml
section.para: This is the equivalent to web-context.xml described here regarding the REST servlet.
